Increment w/o arithmetic operators 04 Jul 2011

An interesting problem came up on Hacker News: given an integer n, compute n + 1 without using any of the basic arithmetic operators: +, -, *, /. Some interesting (and silly) solutions were given (see the link) – I came up with this:

void inc(int& n)
{
  int off = 1;    //bit offset
  while(n & off)  //while the bit at the offset is 1
  {
    n ^= off;     //flip the 1 bit to a 0
    off <<= 1;    //move the offset over
  }
  n ^= off;       //flip the first 0 bit to a 1
}

Uses only bitwise AND, bitwise XOR, and single left bit shifts. Seems to work for positive and negative integers.
